titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: Jane Morris (1813-1897) was the youngest daughter of Israel W. Morris (1778-1870) and Mary Hollingsworth Morris. She lived at Greenhill Farm, Overbrook. Israel Wistar Morris (1833-1909) was the son of Dr. Caspar and Ann (Cheston) Morris. He was the President of the Locust Mountain & Coal Company and a land agent for the Lehigh Valley Coal Company.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of family papers of the Morris, Cheston, Galloway, Hollingsworth, and Buckley families. Materials include typescript copies of wills, family anecdotes, and genealogies. Some of the records appear to be original family history research, possibly created by Israel W. Morris or Jane Morris. The collection includes typescript or printed wills of Wistar Morris, Galloway Cheston, Jane Morris, Israel W. Morris. The collection also includes letters (1905-1908) from Mrs. Clapham Murray to Israel Wistar Morris regarding his requests for information on the Morris, Hollingsworth, and Cheston families; and a copy of a brief title to Greenhill Farm, Overbrook, and a survey map of the proposed subdivision of Greenhill Farm.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Gift of the Moyerman family.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Historical Society of Pennsylvania: Morris family papers (collection 2000B & 2000C).
